As discussed in SIG Registries meeting earlier today, we came to a conclusion that https://github.com/bytecodealliance/wit-deps should eventually output and take as input Wasm components. @Peter Huene @Luke Wagner could you take a look at https://github.com/bytecodealliance/wit-deps/issues/25 (and check if that aligns with what you had in mind)?

WIT dependency manager. Contribute to bytecodealliance/wit-deps development by creating an account on GitHub.
Use Wasm to hash dep components, rather than `tar` 路 Issue #25 路 bytecodealliance/wit-deps
Refs #24 Instead of tar-packing the dependencies to compute the digest, use https://github.com/bytecodealliance/wasm-tools to assemble a "virtual world" containing all the interfaces within the fet...
I've added a comment with some feedback. The gist being that generating a component from the wit deps and current wit is the most important part and you can probably split this into phases.
